verses.kjv: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.web: The word that came to Jeremiah from LORD, saying,
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.kjv: Stand in the gate of the LORD’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of the LORD, all ye of Judah, that enter in at these gates to worship the LORD.
verses.web: “Stand in the gate of LORD’s house, and proclaim this word there, and say, ‘Hear LORD’s word, all you of Judah, who enter in at these gates to worship LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: "Go stand at the gate of the LORD's temple and announce this message: 'Listen to the word of the LORD, all you people of Judah who come through these gates to worship the LORD.'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
verses.web: LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, “Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: "Change your ways and your actions, and I will let you go on living in this place.

verses.kjv: Trust ye not in lying words, saying, The temple of the LORD, The temple of the LORD, The temple of the LORD, are these.
verses.web: Don’t trust in lying words, saying, ‘LORD’s temple, LORD’s temple, LORD’s temple, are these.’
verses.ct: Don't put your trust in the lie that says, 'The temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD is here!'

verses.kjv: For if ye throughly amend your ways and your doings; if ye throughly execute judgment between a man and his neighbour;
verses.web: For if you thoroughly amend your ways and your doings, if you thoroughly execute justice between a man and his neighbor;
verses.ct: If you truly change your ways and your actions — if you deal fairly with one another,

verses.kjv: If ye oppress not the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, and shed not innocent blood in this place, neither walk after other gods to your hurt:
verses.web: if you don’t oppress the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, and don’t shed innocent blood in this place, and don’t walk after other gods to your own hurt;
verses.ct: if you stop exploiting foreigners, orphans, and widows, if you stop shedding innocent blood in this place, and if you stop chasing after other gods to your own ruin —

verses.kjv: Then will I cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, for ever and ever.
verses.web: then I will cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, from of old even forever more.
verses.ct: then I will let you go on living in this place, in the land I gave to your ancestors forever and ever.

verses.kjv: Behold, ye trust in lying words, that cannot profit.
verses.web: Behold, you trust in lying words that can’t profit.
verses.ct: But look at you — you're trusting in lies that do you no good at all.

verses.kjv: Will ye steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense unto Baal, and walk after other gods whom ye know not;
verses.web: Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, burn incense to Baal, and walk after other gods that you have not known,
verses.ct: Will you really steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, burn incense to Baal, and run after gods you've never even known,

verses.kjv: And come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, We are delivered to do all these abominations?
verses.web: then come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, ‘We are delivered,’ that you may do all these abominations?
verses.ct: and then come stand before me in this house that bears my name and say, 'We're safe!' — just so you can keep doing all these disgusting things?

verses.kjv: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, even I have seen it, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Has this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, I myself have seen it,” says LORD.
verses.ct: Has this house that bears my name become a den of robbers to you? I've been watching — I've seen it all," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: But go ye now unto my place which was in Shiloh, where I set my name at the first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.
verses.web: “But go now to my place which was in Shiloh, where I caused my name to dwell at the first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.
verses.ct: "Go to the place where I first established my name — my sanctuary at Shiloh — and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of my people Israel.

verses.kjv: And now, because ye have done all these works, saith the LORD, and I spake unto you, rising up early and speaking, but ye heard not; and I called you, but ye answered not;
verses.web: Now, because you have done all these works,” says LORD, “and I spoke to you, rising up early and speaking, but you didn’t hear; and I called you, but you didn’t answer;
verses.ct: Now, because you have done all these things," says the LORD, "and because I spoke to you again and again but you wouldn't listen, and I called out to you but you wouldn't answer —

verses.kjv: Therefore will I do unto this house, which is called by my name, wherein ye trust, and unto the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I have done to Shiloh.
verses.web: therefore I will do to the house which is called by my name, in which you trust, and to the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.
verses.ct: I will do to this house that bears my name, this place you trust in, this land I gave to you and your ancestors, exactly what I did to Shiloh.

verses.kjv: And I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brethren, even the whole seed of Ephraim.
verses.web: I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brothers, even the whole offspring of Ephraim.
verses.ct: I will throw you out of my presence, just as I threw out all your relatives — the entire tribe of Ephraim."

verses.kjv: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession to me: for I will not hear thee.
verses.web: “Therefore don’t pray for this people. Don’t lift up a cry or prayer for them or make intercession to me; for I will not hear you.
verses.ct: "So don't pray for these people, Jeremiah. Don't cry out or plead on their behalf. Don't beg me to help them, because I won't listen to you.

verses.kjv: Seest thou not what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.web: Don’t you see what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.ct: Don't you see what they're doing in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

verses.kjv: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead their dough, to make cakes to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offerings unto other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.
verses.web: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead the dough, to make cakes to the queen of the sky, and to pour out drink offerings to other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.
verses.ct: The children gather firewood, the fathers light the fire, and the women knead dough to make cakes for the queen of heaven. They pour out drink offerings to other gods just to make me angry.

verses.kjv: Do they provoke me to anger? saith the LORD: do they not provoke themselves to the confusion of their own faces?
verses.web: Do they provoke me to anger?” says LORD. “Don’t they provoke themselves, to the confusion of their own faces?”
verses.ct: But am I really the one they're hurting?" says the LORD. "Aren't they hurting themselves, bringing shame on their own heads?"

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, mine anger and my fury shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.
verses.web: Therefore the Lord LORD says: “Behold, my anger and my wrath will be poured out on this place, on man, on animal, on the trees of the field, and on the fruit of the ground; and it will burn and will not be quenched.”
verses.ct: So the Lord GOD says: "Watch — my anger and my fury will be poured out on this place, on people and animals alike, on the trees in the fields and the crops in the ground. It will burn and nothing will put it out."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Put your burnt offerings unto your sacrifices, and eat flesh.
verses.web: LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says: “Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices and eat meat.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: "Go ahead — pile your burnt offerings on top of your other sacrifices and eat the meat yourselves.

verses.kjv: For I spake not unto your fathers, nor commanded them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices:
verses.web: For I didn’t speak to your fathers or command them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices;
verses.ct: When I brought your ancestors out of Egypt, I didn't say a word to them about burnt offerings or sacrifices.

verses.kjv: But this thing commanded I them, saying, Obey my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people: and walk ye in all the ways that I have commanded you, that it may be well unto you.
verses.web: but this thing I commanded them, saying, ‘Listen to my voice, and I will be your God, and you shall be my people. Walk in all the way that I command you, that it may be well with you.’
verses.ct: What I did command them was this: 'Listen to my voice, and I will be your God, and you will be my people. Walk in every path I lay out for you, so that things will go well for you.'

verses.kjv: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear, but walked in the counsels and in the imagination of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward.
verses.web: But they didn’t listen or turn their ear, but walked in their own counsels and in the stubbornness of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward.
verses.ct: But they refused to listen. They wouldn't pay attention. Instead, they followed their own plans and the stubbornness of their evil hearts. They went backward, not forward.

verses.kjv: Since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt unto this day I have even sent unto you all my servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them:
verses.web: Since the day that your fathers came out of the land of Egypt to this day, I have sent to you all my servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them.
verses.ct: From the day your ancestors left Egypt until today, I have sent you all my servants the prophets — day after day, without fail.

verses.kjv: Yet they hearkened not unto me, nor inclined their ear, but hardened their neck: they did worse than their fathers.
verses.web: Yet they didn’t listen to me or incline their ear, but made their neck stiff. They did worse than their fathers.
verses.ct: But they wouldn't listen to me or pay attention. They stiffened their necks and acted even worse than their ancestors did.

verses.kjv: Therefore thou shalt speak all these words unto them; but they will not hearken to thee: thou shalt also call unto them; but they will not answer thee.
verses.web: “You shall speak all these words to them, but they will not listen to you. You shall also call to them, but they will not answer you.
verses.ct: "You will tell them all of this, but they won't listen to you. You will call out to them, but they won't answer.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt say unto them, This is a nation that obeyeth not the voice of the LORD their God, nor receiveth correction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth.
verses.web: You shall tell them, ‘This is the nation that has not listened to LORD their God’s voice, nor received instruction. Truth has perished, and is cut off from their mouth.’
verses.ct: So say to them: 'This is a nation that refuses to obey the LORD their God and won't accept correction. Truth has died — it has vanished from their lips.'"

verses.kjv: Cut off thine hair, O Jerusalem, and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on high places; for the LORD hath rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.
verses.web: Cut off your hair, and throw it away, and take up a lamentation on the bare heights; for LORD has rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.
verses.ct: "Cut off your hair, Jerusalem, and throw it away. Raise a funeral song on the barren hilltops, because the LORD has rejected and abandoned this generation that provoked his wrath.

verses.kjv: For the children of Judah have done evil in my sight, saith the LORD: they have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to pollute it.
verses.web: “For the children of Judah have done that which is evil in my sight,” says LORD. “They have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.
verses.ct: The people of Judah have done what I consider evil," says the LORD. "They have set up their disgusting idols in the house that bears my name, defiling it.

verses.kjv: And they have built the high places of Tophet, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire; which I commanded them not, neither came it into my heart.
verses.web: They have built the high places of Topheth, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire; which I didn’t command, nor did it come into my mind.
verses.ct: They have built the pagan shrines of Topheth in the valley of the son of Hinnom, where they burn their own sons and daughters in the fire — something I never commanded and never even imagined.

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that it shall no more be called Tophet, nor the valley of the son of Hinnom, but the valley of slaughter: for they shall bury in Tophet, till there be no place.
verses.web: Therefore behold, the days come”, says LORD, “that it will no more be called ‘Topheth’ or ‘The valley of the son of Hinnom’, but ‘The valley of Slaughter’; for they will bury in Topheth until there is no place to bury.
verses.ct: So the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when it will no longer be called Topheth or the valley of the son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter — because they will bury the dead in Topheth until there's no room left.

verses.kjv: And the carcases of this people shall be meat for the fowls of the heaven, and for the beasts of the earth; and none shall fray them away.
verses.web: The dead bodies of this people will be food for the birds of the sky, and for the animals of the earth. No one will frighten them away.
verses.ct: The corpses of this people will become food for the birds of the sky and the wild animals, and no one will be there to scare them away.

verses.kjv: Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride: for the land shall be desolate.
verses.web: Then I will cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land will become a waste.”
verses.ct: I will silence the sounds of joy and celebration in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem — no more laughter, no more wedding songs of brides and grooms. The land will become a wasteland."
